Cleve_Francis:
{{short description|American singer-songwriter}} {{Use mdy dates|date=September 2020}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Cleve Francis | image = | image_size = | birth_name = Cleveland Francis, Jr.{{cite book|last=Whitburn|first=Joel|title=Hot Country Songs 1944 to 2008|publisher=Record Research, Inc|year=2008|page=150|isbn=978-0-89820-177-2}} | alias = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1945|04|22}}{{cite web |url={{AllMusic|class=artist|id=p30158/biography|pure_url=yes}} |title=Cleve Francis biography |accessdate=May 31, 2008 |last=Loftus |first=Johnny |work=[[Allmusic]]}} | origin = [[Jennings, Louisiana]], U.S. | instrument = Vocals, guitar | genre = {{hlist|[[Country Music|Country]]|[[Folk music|Folk]]}} | occupation = Singer-songwriter, cardiologist | years_active = 1970{{endash}}present | label = Playback,
[[Liberty Records|Liberty]], Forager | website = [http://www.clevefrancis.com http://www.clevefrancis.com] }} '''Cleveland Francis''' (born April 22, 1945) is an American [[country music]] singer, songwriter, and cardiologist. Active since the late 1960s, Francis has recorded a total of nine albums, including three for [[Liberty Records]]. He has charted four times on ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Hot Country Songs]], most successfully with "You Do My Heart Good" in 1992. ==Biography== Francis began his music career as a folk and blues singer and songwriter in the late 1960s while still a graduate student at the [[College of William & Mary]], where he graduated with a [[Master of Arts]] degree in 1969.{{cite magazine |last=Eshleman |first=Tina |date=January 2023 |title=Heart & Soul |url=https://alumni.wm.edu/magazine_pdf/2023-winter.pdf |magazine=William & Mary Alumni Magazine |location=[[Williamsburg, Virginia]] |publisher=[[College of William & Mary]] |access-date=January 24, 2023}} He attended medical school at the Medical College of Virginia (now [[VCU School of Medicine|Virginia Commonwealth University School of Medicine]]), eventually becoming a [[cardiologist]]. However, in the late 1980s he switched his focus to country music, signing first to Playback Records. His debut country album ''Last Call for Love'' was released that year. The album included a single titled "Love Light", which was also made into a [[music video]].{{cite news | url=https://www.newspapers.com/image/132285874/ | title=Cleve Francis is a country (music) doctor | work=The Des Moines Register | date=April 17, 1992 | accessdate=July 16, 2021 | pages=16T}} After seeing the video for "Love Light" on [[CMT (American TV channel)|CMT]], record producer [[Jimmy Bowen]] signed Francis to [[Liberty Records]] in 1992. Between 1992 and 1994, Francis released three studio albums on Liberty, in addition to charting four singles on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' Hot Country Singles & Tracks (now [[Hot Country Songs]]) charts. In 1994 Francis returned to his medical practice in Northern Virginia. He is president of Mount Vernon Cardiology Associates.{{cite web |url=http://www.clevefrancis.com/biography.htm} |title=Thumbnail Biography of Cleve Francis |accessdate=December 19, 2019}} Francis has performed at [[The Birchmere]] in [[Alexandria, Virginia]], and has a live album recorded there in 2006 called ''Storytime''.{{cite web | url=https://music.apple.com/us/album/storytime/213586214 | title=''Storytime'' | work=iTunes Store | accessdate=July 16, 2021}} In 2022, Francis released "Beyond the Willow Tree" on Forager Records, a remastered reissue of his 1970 self-released folk album, "Follow Me," which includes several other folk songs Francis had recorded as demos in 1968 and 1970.{{Cite web |title=Beyond The Willow Tree, by Cleveland Francis |url=https://clevelandfrancis.bandcamp.com/album/beyond-the-willow-tree-2 |access-date=2023-01-09 |website=Cleveland Francis |language=en}} ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2" style="width:14em;"| Title ! rowspan="2" style="width:18em;"| Album details ! colspan="2"| Peak chart
